description: Several hostages were rescued during a multiday operation involving multiple law enforcement agencies, the F.B.I. said. One suspect died after “an agent-involved shooting” and a second was taken into custody.
title: Suspect Dead After Hostages Rescued in Houston F.B.I. Operation
title_page: Suspect Dead After Hostages Rescued in Houston F.B.I. Operation - The New York Times
maintext:
A hostage rescue in Houston that lasted several days ended on Thursday with one suspect shot dead and a second suspect in custody, the F.B.I. said.
The federal agency had been working to rescue two hostages held in a Studio 6 motel in the Houston area when the shooting happened at about 4:30 a.m., officials said at a news conference on Thursday.
James Smith, the special agent in charge of the F.B.I.’s Houston office, said that the two hostages had been “safely rescued,” and that the second suspect had been detained by the Harris County Sheriff’s Department. “No agents were injured,” he added. “At this time, there is no threat to public safety.”
A prosecutor told The Associated Press on Thursday that the situation began days ago when three migrants were kidnapped from a vehicle in a neighboring county.
